data.q: Which statement is used to handle runtime errors in JavaScript?
data.e: JavaScript handles runtime errors using the try...catch statement.

data.q: What type of error occurs when JavaScript code has invalid syntax?
data.e: SyntaxError occurs when the JavaScript engine encounters invalid syntax.

data.q: Which error is thrown when accessing a variable that has not been declared?
data.e: ReferenceError occurs when a variable is not defined in the current scope.

data.q: What does the finally block do in try...catch...finally?
o: Runs only if an error occurs
Runs only if no error occurs
data.e: The finally block always executes, whether an error occurs or not.

data.q: Which keyword is used to manually raise an error in JavaScript?
data.e: The throw keyword is used to create custom errors in JavaScript.

data.q: What type of error occurs when calling a method on null or undefined?
data.e: TypeError occurs when an operation is performed on an incompatible value like null or undefined.

data.q: Which built-in object is commonly used for debugging output?
data.e: The console object is used for debugging via methods like console.log().

data.q: Which console method is best suited for printing error messages?
data.e: console.error() is specifically intended for error messages.

data.q: What happens if an exception is thrown and not caught?
data.e: An uncaught exception stops JavaScript execution and may crash the script.

data.q: Which statement is commonly used to inspect program flow during debugging?
data.e: console.log() is widely used to inspect values and program flow during debugging.
